title: Magnetic field - slab with varying current density

content.question: A large slab is centered on the <math alttext="x z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>z</mi></math>-plane and extends very far in the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>- and <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>z</mi></math>-directions. The slab extends from <math alttext="y equals negative d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>d</mi></mpadded></math> to <math alttext="y equals positive d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></mpadded></math> in the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-direction, as shown. The slab has a current density directed in the <math alttext="positive z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>z</mi></math>-direction given by <math alttext="vector J equals a y squared times k hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover accent="true"><mi>J</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mover accent="true"><mi>k</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>. The magnitude of the magnetic field at the top and bottom surfaces of the slab is <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>. Which of the following is equal to the magnetic field at <math alttext="y equals the fraction with numerator d, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator B, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>B</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction with numerator B, and denominator 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>B</mi><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="the fraction with numerator B, and denominator 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>B</mi><mn>8</mn></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator B, and denominator 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>B</mi><mn>8</mn></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
